thread.title: Obama to commemorate 9/11 anniversary at Ft. Meade
thread.title_full: Obama to commemorate 9/11 anniversary at Ft. Meade

author: Jordan Fabian
title: Obama to commemorate 9/11 anniversary at Ft. Meade
text: Obama to commemorate 9/11 anniversary at Ft. Meade By Jordan Fabian - 09/09/15 01:58 PM EDT President Obama will travel to Fort Meade on Friday to mark the 14th anniversary of the Sept. 11 terrorist attacks. Obama will meet with military service members at the Maryland base, spokesman Eric Schultz told reporters on Air Force One. The president and first lady Michelle Obama will participate in a moment of silence with White House staff on the South Lawn. ADVERTISEMENT “The president looks forward to having conversations with patriotic men and women who work every day to keep America safe and to honor the sacrifices of troops and their families,” Schultz said. Fort Meade is home to several federal agencies, including the National Security Agency, which was embroiled in a controversy over a post-9/11 program allowing bulk collection of Americans’ phone records. Located 26 miles north of Washington, Fort Meade employs 52,000 people, making it the third-largest Army installation in the United States. Past: 1 day House GOP to postpone vote on Iran...
